tone_framing: Frame the tour as a treasure hunt for green objects and their stories.
key_takeaways: Green ceramics were treasured across Asia for their beauty, symbolism, and craftsmanship.
The Qing dynasty introduced brilliant translucent green enamel, prized at both Chinese and European courts.
Korean potters developed their own green-glazed ceramics, combining Chinese influences with local traditions.
creative_activities: Find the green objects in the exhibit and guess their origins using clues provided by the guide.
Design your own robe or ceramic bowl using meaningful colors and patterns inspired by the exhibit.
Discuss how green objects from history connect to their favorite green objects today (plants, clothing, etc.).
